column180: representing 50 to 150 basis points of margin expansion year-over-year. We continue to take a balanced approach to investments and profitability in Ratings. And through continued expense discipline and improved efficiencies
column181: we expect to deliver margins in the range of 63% to 64%

column183: we expect revenue growth in the range of 7% to 8.5% and margins in the range of 47% to 48%. We expect continued robust demand for our energy transition products as well as our market-leading Platts price assessments. Given the long runway and secular tailwinds in this business
column184: we continue to invest to further distance ourselves from competitors in this space. Despite the ongoing investments
column185: we expect to deliver 20 to 120 basis points of margin expansion in CI with an expected margin range of 47% to 48% in 2025. In Mobility
column186: we expect continued strong growth in the range of 7% to 8.5%. We have reinvested revenue upside in the last couple of years
column188: but we expect the necessary pace of investment to slow somewhat in 2025. Lastly
column190: our guidance assumes relatively flat equity asset prices from the end of 2024
column191: given the very strong returns in the S&P 500 over the last 2 years. As such
column192: we expect revenue growth in the range of 8% to 10%. Given margins are already above our medium-term targets and given the attractive slate of investment opportunities in Indices
column193: we are making the decision to reinvest incremental profit for future growth in 2025. As a result
column194: we expect margins to remain relatively flat to 2024 levels and are guiding to a range of 69.5% to 70.5%. I refer you to our supplemental materials on our Investor Relations website for some additional details on our financial guidance
column195: but we are also expecting to deliver approximately $6 billion in adjusted free cash flow in 2020. Since the merger closed
column196: our free cash flow conversion rate
column197: or adjusted free cash flow as a percentage of adjusted net income
column198: has been at or above 100% every year and peaked in 2024 as we optimized our working capital and streamlined cash collections. This does create a difficult compare for working capital and free cash flow growth in 2025
column199: but we expect to maintain a free cash flow conversion rate at or above 100% in 2025 as well. In closing
column200: through the various leadership roles I've held over the last 15 years within S&P Global
column201: I've seen the ins and outs of our businesses up close at every stage of the cycle. Our company sits at the crossroads with so many vitally important secular trends: data and artificial intelligence
column203: active to passive management and public and private market dynamics. It's an incredibly exciting time to be at S&P Global.""

column1: ""content"": ""From the perspective of a top executive
column2: please answer the following question raised by a financial analyst during an earnings conference call. Knowledge cutoff date: 2025-02-11""
and thank you for joining today's S&P Global Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Call. Presenting on today's call are Martina Cheung
column3: President and Chief Executive Officer; and Chris Craig
column4: Interim Chief Financial Officer. We issued a press release with our results earlier today. In addition
column5: we have posted a supplemental slide deck with additional information on our results and guidance. The matters discussed in today's conference call may contain forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995
column6: including projections
column7: estimates and descriptions of future events. Any such statements are based on current expectations and current economic conditions and are subject to risks and uncertainties and that may cause actual results to differ materially from results anticipated in these forward-looking statements. Additional information concerning these risks and uncertainties can be found in our Forms 10-K and 10-Q filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. In today's press release and during the conference call
column8: we are providing non-GAAP adjusted financial information. This information is provided to enable investors to make meaningful comparisons of the company's operating performance between periods and to view the company's business from the same perspective as management. I would also like to call your attention to certain European regulations. Any investor who has or expects to obtain ownership of 5% or more of S&P Global should contact Investor Relations to better understand the potential impact of this legislation on the investor and the company. We are aware that we have some media representatives with us on the call. However
column9: this call is intended for investors
column10: and we would ask that questions from the media be directed to our Media Relations team
column11: whose contact information can be found in the press release. At this time
column12: I would like to turn the call over to Martina Cheung. Martina? We benefited from strong market trends
column13: including record debt issuance for our Ratings business and strong equity valuations for our index business. However
column14: we also continue to demonstrate the discipline and operational excellence our shareholders have come to expect from us
column15: delivering accelerated revenue growth in Commodity Insights and strong steady growth in both Market Intelligence and Mobility
column16: despite some market headwinds on those 2 businesses. We continue to take a balanced approach to profitability and investment
column17: which allowed us to make important investments in technology
column18: AI and products while still expanding margins more than 300 basis points. This exceeded the midpoint of our initial guidance range by more than 13%. In total
column19: you'll see this would allow us to maintain our target of returning 85% or more of the $6 billion in adjusted free cash flow we are expecting in 2025. I've been very impressed with our people's ability to execute and deliver such strong results
column20: embracing the leadership transition and the increased focus on our customers and our enterprise advantages. With that increased focus on serving our clients at the enterprise level
column21: we announced the establishment of the Chief Client Office and the Enterprise Data Office. We're excited to share the successes from these initiatives with you as we progress through the year. We are gaining momentum in our product innovation and AI initiatives across the organization as well
column22: as I'll share with you in a moment. Lastly
column23: we continue the cycle of optimizing our portfolio of businesses
column24: so that we are best positioned for long-term profitable growth. One of my first priorities as CEO was to strengthen and deepen our relationship with key strategic customers at the highest levels of leadership. I had more than 100 meetings with some of our most important stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition of these key relationships. These important discussions include not just our customers
column25: but also strategic
column26: commercial and technology partners. Together with our new Chief Client Officer
column27: I met 85% of our largest strategic customers just in the last 100 days. We are instilling in our executive leadership team
column28: a clear need to be where our customers are. Our success depends on the value we create and deliver for our customers
column29: so I've asked our division leadership to make these relationships a personal priority for them as well. This emphasis on customer engagement is a natural evolution for S&P Global. We've always made customer value a focus. But by making customer engagement a higher priority at the executive level
column30: we are building stronger relationships
column31: so that we can accelerate our response to customers' challenges. This engagement can also serve as opportunities to partner or co-invest with our customers. Through these many meetings
column32: I'm picking up a consistent set of themes
column33: which align very well with our competitive advantages and reinvigorate our optimism and confidence in our ability to compete and win. While generative AI is not a new topic for our customers
column34: they're moving beyond just considering what this technology can do and focusing on use cases that can scale quickly and contribute to strong financial results. Customers increasingly turn to us to benefit from our years of experience scaling AI technology from Kensho. We continue to see impactful headlines and market news on a near daily basis. Customers are deeply engaged to determine the potential impact to their business from tariffs
column35: regional competitiveness and other aspects of global trade. S&P Global is a world-class provider of data insights and thought leadership in these vital areas
column36: and our customers are turning to us for that expertise. Customers continue to feel the impact of the innovation taking place in financial markets with the flow of capital to passive funds
column37: but also increasingly to private markets and digital assets. Through our leadership in benchmarks
column38: private credit
column39: private equity workflow tools and innovation like our Stablecoin Assessments
column40: our customers see us as a critical partner in navigating this sea change over the coming years. Additionally
column41: customers recognize our leadership and seek our insights in energy transition. For example
column42: in utilities
column43: the depth and breadth of our expertise and data sets across oil
column44: liquid natural gas
column45: carbon
column46: renewable energy
column47: electric utilities and reporting all helped drive the 23% growth in revenue from our energy transition and sustainability products in the fourth quarter. As we look to 2025
column48: we are hearing general expectations for some improvements in the macroeconomic environment. There is some variability by geographic region here
column49: with caution and uncertainty around Europe and Asia
column50: providing some ballast against the general optimism we're seeing in the U.S. markets. We are seeing strong demand for our products and some modest tailwinds from vendor consolidation. We continue to see the benefits from the breadth of our offerings
column51: as our enterprise approach allows us to meet more of our customers' needs in a more cost-effective way. As we've discussed for some time now
column52: we continue to see conditions in the financial services end market below what we would consider normal
column53: though we do expect a gradual improvement over the course of the year. We are also experiencing a highly competitive environment in financial services and somewhat elevated price sensitivity
column54: most notably impacting Market Intelligence. Now turning to the 2024 issuance environment. While this does create a very difficult compare for 2025
column55: we believe the refinancing walls and a recovering M&A environment will contribute to modest growth in build issuance this year
column56: as we'll discuss in more detail in a moment. As we look next to the Vitality Index
column57: I'm encouraged that this index continues to accomplish its intended purpose. When we introduced this metric at our Investor Day in 2022
column58: we discussed the importance of making sure we were prioritizing new products that can contribute to our financial performance over time. The focus is to make sure that revenue from maturing products is replaced by new and enhanced products that can scale quickly. At the beginning of 2024
column59: we had a number of meaningful products mature out of the Vitality Index. By continuing to innovate and invest in fast growing products
column60: we were able to more than replace that mature revenue and end the year with an index of $1.5 billion
column61: representing nearly 11% of total revenue. At the end of 2024

column63: and we are confident that our focus on customer value and rapid innovation will once again enable us to deliver a Vitality Index at or above 10% this year. Turning to just a few examples of that innovation. As the world's leading provider of benchmarks
column64: we continue to invest and innovate to launch new benchmark products and make our existing benchmarks better. We know that data and technology lay at the heart of almost everything we do
column65: so we continue to make meaningful investments in our internal technology and our technology products. Part of our focus on technology must include a strategy to leverage the incredible technological advancement taking place in the world today
column66: such as generative AI. First
column67: beginning with our people. We are continuing to build a culture that embraces AI
column68: and we are empowering our people with the tools

column71: more quickly ingest new information and more efficiently generate their own work products. We firmly believe that as we embrace the use of AI internally

column73: tools and resources that improve our productivity and efficiency will likely benefit our customers as well. Through ongoing customer meetings
column74: we hear
column75: again and again
column76: they want to be able to access and integrate S&P Global's data into their AI workloads. This is all part of our ongoing effort to bring our data into this new era of GenAI and ensure that we are meeting customers where they are and where they are going in their AI journeys. We also identified and acquired market-leading solutions that we believe strengthen our competitive position in multiple areas
column77: while contributing to the immediate financial results of the company. With the ultimate goal of driving profitable long-term revenue growth
column78: we will continue to lean into these kinds of innovation: development of tools for our own efficiency and productivity
column79: organic development of new products for our customers
column80: partnerships to develop new products and token acquisitions to accelerate the pace of scale and leadership. You'll notice that across these examples of innovation runs a common thread of generative AI. When we look at the potential for generative AI across the business over the next several years
column81: there are seemingly endless opportunities to innovate and add value for our customers. We're doing this in many ways
column82: including building sophisticated GenAI experiences
column83: laying the groundwork for agentive workflows and investing in foundational AI capabilities that help our customers more quickly and effectively gain insights from our data. In the coming quarters and years
column84: you'll see us lean more into practical applications that have the potential to move the needle on financial performance and enhance the value of our products. We will prioritize those use cases that improve our revenue growth potential
column85: improve our operational productivity and efficiency
column86: improve the capabilities and skills of our people and safeguard the security around our proprietary data and our systems. This will require us to say no to a lot of things
column87: but will allow us to effectively put investment dollars to work in ways that have the greatest potential to create real value. Now turning to our financial results. Chris will walk through the fourth quarter results in more detail in a moment
column88: but we are pleased and encouraged by the results we delivered for our shareholders in 2024. We continue to see strong growth in our market-driven and our subscription businesses

column92: we would have had year-over-year margin expansion in every division. Now I'll turn to Chris to review the financial results. Thank you
column93: Martina. We finished 2024 with strong results as fourth quarter revenue grew by 14% compared to the prior year
column94: with growth across all of our divisions. Notably
column95: our market-driven businesses
column96: Ratings and Indices each grew by over 20% in the quarter as we capitalized on favorable conditions in both the debt and equity markets. This is driven by a combination of our strong revenue growth
column97: margin expansion of 260 basis points and a 2% reduction in fully diluted share count. Now turning to strategic investment areas
column98: where I'm excited to share that there was positive momentum across our key initiatives
column99: all of which are helping drive sustainable growth for the company. In Private Markets Solutions
column100: revenue growth accelerated to 29% to $146 million in the fourth quarter. Growth was driven primarily by continued strong demand for our private market ratings and assessments within S&P Global Ratings. During the quarter
column101: we realized $74 million in revenue synergies. We are pleased to see both cross-sell and new product revenue synergies coming in above our expectations in Q4. As previously highlighted
column102: we anticipate a steady stream of innovative offerings to replace any products graduating from the index

column105: commissions and compensation. The significant outperformance in our Ratings and Indices divisions during the fourth quarter increased incentive compensation across the enterprise. Turning to our divisions. Market Intelligence revenue increased 5% in the fourth quarter or 6% excluding acquisitions and divestitures
column106: with positive revenue growth in every business line. We continue to see the effect of cancellations early in 2024 impacting revenue growth in the fourth quarter. We also had significant competitive wins in each of the business lines in Market Intelligence and no significant competitive losses. This should position Market Intelligence to see gradually improving revenue growth rates as we progress through 2025. Enterprise Solutions grew 6%

column120: respectively. Growth was driven by strength in our traditional offerings

And now turning to Mobility. Manufacturing revenue increased 1% as the business line continued to see lower transaction revenue related to our Recall business

column124: and we expect to fully lap that headwind by the second quarter of 2025. Growth in financials and other accelerated to 18% as the business line benefited from strong underwriting volumes and market share growth. This resulted in operating profit increasing by 12% for the quarter and operating margin expanding by 100 basis points to 34.7%. Data & Custom Subscriptions increased 5% year-over-year as we continue to implement commercial initiatives across the various product offerings within the business line. However
column125: growth in the fourth quarter was partially offset by a retrospective revenue adjustment. Excluding the impact of this onetime headwind

column127: and our financial results reflect that. As we look to 2025 and beyond

column131: which we think should contribute to a stable issuance environment and a gradually improving backdrop for our financial services customers as we progress through 2025. We acknowledge
column132: however
column133: the degree of macro and geopolitical uncertainty that exists right now and that there is a range of potential outcomes beyond our base case assumptions. Our base case assumption is that we see at least one more rate cut this year in the U.S. We recognize that market expectations around the pace of 2025 breakups have moderated over the last several months. But as we've seen in recent years
column134: these rate movements are difficult to predict with a high degree of confidence. As such

column136: however
column137: are approximately 1% lower than they were 12 months ago. Our billed issuance forecast takes both of these rates into account. Given the record issuance here we've had and the deceleration we are expecting in 2025

column139: we saw an acceleration in the pull forward of the 2025 maturity wall during the fourth quarter
column140: which impacts our outlook in 2 ways. First
column141: it drove stronger issuance than we expected during the fourth quarter of 2024. We saw that in our financial results
column142: and it creates a more difficult compare this year. We continue to expect favorable market conditions around stable rates and credit spreads
column143: and we are encouraged by the robust maturity walls over the next few years
column144: all of which inspires confidence that issuance will see positive growth in 2025. We also expect some improvement in the M&A environment relative to the last couple of years
column145: and there should be some tailwinds to issuance as a result. Lastly
column146: our expectation is that the mix of issuance is likely to shift slightly in favor of investment grade compared to what we saw in 2024. Against that backdrop
column147: we are introducing our financial guidance for 2025. This slide illustrates our guidance for GAAP results. Moving to our adjusted guidance. We expect revenue growth in the range of 5% to 7% in 2025. Turning to our outlook by division. In Market Intelligence
column148: we expect revenue growth in the range of 5% to 6.5%. We exited 2024 with a very strong renewal quarter

column150: but we would still be lapping the elevated cancellations from the prior quarters. As a result

column155: as billed issuance growth and modest price increases are somewhat offset by expected unfavorable mix of billed issuance. We continue to take a balanced approach to investments and profitability in Ratings. We expect continued robust demand for our energy transition products as well as our market-leading Platts price assessments. Given the long runway and secular tailwinds in this business

column161: we are making the decision to reinvest incremental profit for future growth in 2025. I refer you to our supplemental materials on our Investor Relations website for some additional details on our financial guidance
column162: but we are also expecting to deliver approximately $6 billion in adjusted free cash flow in 2020. In closing
column163: through the various leadership roles I've held over the last 15 years within S&P Global

column1: ""content"": ""From the perspective of a top executive
column2: please answer the following question raised by a financial analyst during an earnings conference call. Knowledge cutoff date: 2025-02-11""
and thank you for joining today's S&P Global Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Call. In addition
column3: we have posted a supplemental slide deck with additional information on our results and guidance. The matters discussed in today's conference call may contain forward-looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995
column4: including projections
column5: estimates and descriptions of future events. Any such statements are based on current expectations and current economic conditions and are subject to risks and uncertainties and that may cause actual results to differ materially from results anticipated in these forward-looking statements. Additional information concerning these risks and uncertainties can be found in our Forms 10-K and 10-Q filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. In today's press release and during the conference call
column6: we are providing non-GAAP adjusted financial information. This information is provided to enable investors to make meaningful comparisons of the company's operating performance between periods and to view the company's business from the same perspective as management. The financial metrics we'll be discussing today refer to non-GAAP adjusted metrics
column7: unless explicitly noted otherwise. We are aware that we have some media representatives with us on the call. However
column8: this call is intended for investors
column9: and we would ask that questions from the media be directed to our Media Relations team
column10: whose contact information can be found in the press release. At this time
column11: I would like to turn the call over to Martina Cheung. Excluding Engineering Solutions
column12: which was divested in 2023
column13: revenue increased 15%
column14: and revenue from our subscription products increased 7%. We benefited from strong market trends
column15: including record debt issuance for our Ratings business and strong equity valuations for our index business. However
column16: we also continue to demonstrate the discipline and operational excellence our shareholders have come to expect from us
column17: delivering accelerated revenue growth in Commodity Insights and strong steady growth in both Market Intelligence and Mobility
column18: despite some market headwinds on those 2 businesses. We continue to take a balanced approach to profitability and investment
column19: which allowed us to make important investments in technology
column20: AI and products while still expanding margins more than 300 basis points. We delivered 25% growth in adjusted EPS in 2024. In total
column21: you'll see this would allow us to maintain our target of returning 85% or more of the $6 billion in adjusted free cash flow we are expecting in 2025. I've been very impressed with our people's ability to execute and deliver such strong results
column22: embracing the leadership transition and the increased focus on our customers and our enterprise advantages. With that increased focus on serving our clients at the enterprise level
column23: we announced the establishment of the Chief Client Office and the Enterprise Data Office. We're excited to share the successes from these initiatives with you as we progress through the year. We are gaining momentum in our product innovation and AI initiatives across the organization as well
column24: as I'll share with you in a moment. Lastly
column25: we continue the cycle of optimizing our portfolio of businesses
column26: so that we are best positioned for long-term profitable growth. We also divested noncore businesses
column27: Fincentric and PrimeOne. One of my first priorities as CEO was to strengthen and deepen our relationship with key strategic customers at the highest levels of leadership. I had more than 100 meetings with some of our most important stakeholders to ensure a smooth transition of these key relationships. These important discussions include not just our customers
column28: but also strategic
column29: commercial and technology partners. Together with our new Chief Client Officer
column30: I met 85% of our largest strategic customers just in the last 100 days. We are instilling in our executive leadership team
column31: a clear need to be where our customers are. Our success depends on the value we create and deliver for our customers
column32: so I've asked our division leadership to make these relationships a personal priority for them as well. This emphasis on customer engagement is a natural evolution for S&P Global. We've always made customer value a focus. But by making customer engagement a higher priority at the executive level
column33: we are building stronger relationships
column34: so that we can accelerate our response to customers' challenges. This engagement can also serve as opportunities to partner or co-invest with our customers. Through these many meetings
column35: I'm picking up a consistent set of themes
column36: which align very well with our competitive advantages and reinvigorate our optimism and confidence in our ability to compete and win. We continue to see impactful headlines and market news on a near daily basis. Customers are deeply engaged to determine the potential impact to their business from tariffs
column37: regional competitiveness and other aspects of global trade. Customers continue to feel the impact of the innovation taking place in financial markets with the flow of capital to passive funds
column38: but also increasingly to private markets and digital assets. Additionally
column39: customers recognize our leadership and seek our insights in energy transition. For example
column40: in utilities
column41: the depth and breadth of our expertise and data sets across oil
column42: liquid natural gas
column43: carbon
column44: renewable energy
column45: electric utilities and reporting all helped drive the 23% growth in revenue from our energy transition and sustainability products in the fourth quarter. As we look to 2025
column46: we are hearing general expectations for some improvements in the macroeconomic environment. There is some variability by geographic region here
column47: with caution and uncertainty around Europe and Asia
column48: providing some ballast against the general optimism we're seeing in the U.S. markets. We are seeing strong demand for our products and some modest tailwinds from vendor consolidation. We continue to see the benefits from the breadth of our offerings
column49: as our enterprise approach allows us to meet more of our customers' needs in a more cost-effective way. As we've discussed for some time now
column50: we continue to see conditions in the financial services end market below what we would consider normal
column51: though we do expect a gradual improvement over the course of the year. We are also experiencing a highly competitive environment in financial services and somewhat elevated price sensitivity
column52: most notably impacting Market Intelligence. Now turning to the 2024 issuance environment. We saw many issuers take advantage in 2024 to refinance debt and felt very strong activity in CLO volumes as well as repricing and amend and extend activity. While this does create a very difficult compare for 2025
column53: we believe the refinancing walls and a recovering M&A environment will contribute to modest growth in build issuance this year
column54: as we'll discuss in more detail in a moment. As we look next to the Vitality Index
column55: I'm encouraged that this index continues to accomplish its intended purpose. When we introduced this metric at our Investor Day in 2022
column56: we discussed the importance of making sure we were prioritizing new products that can contribute to our financial performance over time. The focus is to make sure that revenue from maturing products is replaced by new and enhanced products that can scale quickly. At the beginning of 2024
column57: we had a number of meaningful products mature out of the Vitality Index. By continuing to innovate and invest in fast growing products
column58: we were able to more than replace that mature revenue and end the year with an index of $1.5 billion
column59: representing nearly 11% of total revenue. At the end of 2024
column60: we had another group of products mature out of the Vitality Index
column61: and we are confident that our focus on customer value and rapid innovation will once again enable us to deliver a Vitality Index at or above 10% this year. Turning to just a few examples of that innovation. As the world's leading provider of benchmarks
column62: we continue to invest and innovate to launch new benchmark products and make our existing benchmarks better. In 2024
column63: we expanded the collection of multi-asset class indices offered through S&P Dow Jones Indices
column64: and we launched the Leveraged Loan Indices in partnership with UBS. We know that data and technology lay at the heart of almost everything we do
column65: so we continue to make meaningful investments in our internal technology and our technology products. We are finding new ways to leverage the remarkable data estate that we have
column66: and just one example of that
column67: in 2024 was the introduction of the market fixed income securities data in Capital IQ Pro. We are continuing to build a culture that embraces AI
column68: and we are empowering our people with the tools
column69: training and resources they need to thrive. We firmly believe that as we embrace the use of AI internally
column70: it will unlock significant potential for product innovation as well. Through ongoing customer meetings
column71: we hear
column72: again and again
column73: they want to be able to access and integrate S&P Global's data into their AI workloads. We also identified and acquired market-leading solutions that we believe strengthen our competitive position in multiple areas
column74: while contributing to the immediate financial results of the company. With the ultimate goal of driving profitable long-term revenue growth
column75: we will continue to lean into these kinds of innovation: development of tools for our own efficiency and productivity
column76: organic development of new products for our customers
column77: partnerships to develop new products and token acquisitions to accelerate the pace of scale and leadership. You'll notice that across these examples of innovation runs a common thread of generative AI. When we look at the potential for generative AI across the business over the next several years
column78: there are seemingly endless opportunities to innovate and add value for our customers. We're doing this in many ways
column79: including building sophisticated GenAI experiences
column80: laying the groundwork for agentive workflows and investing in foundational AI capabilities that help our customers more quickly and effectively gain insights from our data. In the coming quarters and years
column81: you'll see us lean more into practical applications that have the potential to move the needle on financial performance and enhance the value of our products. We will prioritize those use cases that improve our revenue growth potential
column82: improve our operational productivity and efficiency
column83: improve the capabilities and skills of our people and safeguard the security around our proprietary data and our systems. This will require us to say no to a lot of things
column84: but will allow us to effectively put investment dollars to work in ways that have the greatest potential to create real value. Now turning to our financial results. Chris will walk through the fourth quarter results in more detail in a moment
column85: but we are pleased and encouraged by the results we delivered for our shareholders in 2024. We continue to see strong growth in our market-driven and our subscription businesses

and thank you for joining today's S&P Global Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Call. In addition
column3: we have posted a supplemental slide deck with additional information on our results and guidance. Any such statements are based on current expectations and current economic conditions and are subject to risks and uncertainties and that may cause actual results to differ materially from results anticipated in these forward-looking statements. Additional information concerning these risks and uncertainties can be found in our Forms 10-K and 10-Q filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. In today's press release and during the conference call
column4: we are providing non-GAAP adjusted financial information. This information is provided to enable investors to make meaningful comparisons of the company's operating performance between periods and to view the company's business from the same perspective as management. The press release contains financial measures calculated in accordance with GAAP that corresponds to the non-GAAP measures we are providing
column5: and the press release and the supplemental deck contain reconciliations of such GAAP and non-GAAP measures. The financial metrics we'll be discussing today refer to non-GAAP adjusted metrics
column6: unless explicitly noted otherwise. We are aware that we have some media representatives with us on the call. However
column7: this call is intended for investors
column8: and we would ask that questions from the media be directed to our Media Relations team
column9: whose contact information can be found in the press release. Excluding Engineering Solutions
column10: which was divested in 2023
column11: revenue increased 15%
column12: and revenue from our subscription products increased 7%. We benefited from strong market trends
column13: including record debt issuance for our Ratings business and strong equity valuations for our index business. However
column14: we also continue to demonstrate the discipline and operational excellence our shareholders have come to expect from us
column15: delivering accelerated revenue growth in Commodity Insights and strong steady growth in both Market Intelligence and Mobility
column16: despite some market headwinds on those 2 businesses. We continue to take a balanced approach to profitability and investment
column17: which allowed us to make important investments in technology
column18: AI and products while still expanding margins more than 300 basis points. We delivered 25% growth in adjusted EPS in 2024. In total
column19: you'll see this would allow us to maintain our target of returning 85% or more of the $6 billion in adjusted free cash flow we are expecting in 2025. I've been very impressed with our people's ability to execute and deliver such strong results
column20: embracing the leadership transition and the increased focus on our customers and our enterprise advantages. With that increased focus on serving our clients at the enterprise level
column21: we announced the establishment of the Chief Client Office and the Enterprise Data Office. We are gaining momentum in our product innovation and AI initiatives across the organization as well
column22: as I'll share with you in a moment. Lastly

column25: but also strategic
column26: commercial and technology partners. Together with our new Chief Client Officer
column27: I met 85% of our largest strategic customers just in the last 100 days. We are instilling in our executive leadership team
column28: a clear need to be where our customers are. Our success depends on the value we create and deliver for our customers
column29: so I've asked our division leadership to make these relationships a personal priority for them as well. This emphasis on customer engagement is a natural evolution for S&P Global. We've always made customer value a focus. But by making customer engagement a higher priority at the executive level

column31: so that we can accelerate our response to customers' challenges. This engagement can also serve as opportunities to partner or co-invest with our customers. While generative AI is not a new topic for our customers
column32: they're moving beyond just considering what this technology can do and focusing on use cases that can scale quickly and contribute to strong financial results. Customers increasingly turn to us to benefit from our years of experience scaling AI technology from Kensho. We continue to see impactful headlines and market news on a near daily basis.
